poem:
Title: "From Fragile Morning Light"

In the shadow of dawn's sad refrain,
Newspaper columns print death's claim,
A war-torn canvas with souls dark-stained,
In Gaza City and Tel Aviv, the same.

Through numbers told, loss incised,
Silent echoes of lives unpriced,
The world divides, then rolls the dice,
Trading dreams for unholy advice.

In this dawn, remains despair,
A bitter sunrise, we share.
prompt: You are the poet Philip Larkin. You woke up this morning feeling contemplative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israel-Gaza war live: UN delays ceasefire vote again after US request; Biden says ‘we’re pushing’ for new hostage deal 7.45pm GMT Summary of the day so far It’s 9.45pm in Gaza City and Tel Aviv. Here’s a recap of the latest developments: At least 20,000 Palestinians have been killed in Gaza since the war began on 7 October, according to the latest figures by the Hamas government’s media office. Among those killed include about 8,000". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Israel-Gaza war live: UN delays ceasefire vote again after US request; Biden says ‘we’re pushing’ for new hostage deal 7.45pm GMT Summary of the day so far It’s 9.45pm in Gaza City and Tel Aviv. Here’s a recap of the latest developments: At least 20,000 Palestinians have been killed in Gaza since the war began on 7 October, according to the latest figures by the Hamas government’s media office. Among those killed include about 8,000
